result:
# Available Tools

## File & Code Operations
- **Read** - Read files from disk
- **Write** - Write files to disk
- **Edit** - Replace text in existing files
- **Glob** - Find files by pattern matching
- **Grep** - Search file contents with regex
- **NotebookEdit** - Edit Jupyter notebook cells

## Execution & Automation
- **Bash** - Run terminal commands
- **Task** - Launch specialized agents (general-purpose, Explore, code-reviewer, etc.)
- **SlashCommand** - Execute custom slash commands (e.g., `/test-parallel`)

## Planning & Tracking
- **TodoWrite** - Create and manage task lists

## Web & Information
- **WebFetch** - Fetch and analyze web content
- **WebSearch** - Search the web for information

## Browser Automation
- **mcp__playwright__browser_*** - Full browser control (navigate, click, type, screenshot, etc.)

## Planning & Design
- **ExitPlanMode** - Signal completion of planning phase for code tasks

## Context Management
- **Skill** - Execute available skills (if any loaded)

---

**Quick Note**: I prioritize specialized tools over bash for file operations (Read/Edit/Write over cat/sed). I also make parallel tool calls when tasks are independent to maximize efficiency.
